WHAT DO YOU WANT TO DO

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: See, man ain’t like a dog. Pop! The pounding stops. The lighter ejects. D.Jay lights a cigarette and speaks t someone sitting shotgun in his parked car. D.Jay is an intense looking, black man in his thirties.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m talkin’ about mankind, not man like men, cuz men... well, we a lot like a dog. You know we... piss on things. Sniff a bitch when we can, get a pink hard-on like they do. And we territorial. You know, we protect our own. {a quick drag) But, man... he know about death. He got religion. Got a sense of history. Dogs don’t know shit about birthdays or Christmas or that one day God gonna come callin’. So they walkin’ through life, you know, carefree. But people like you and me, we always guessin’. Always wantin’ to know “what if”, naw what I mean? D.Jay scans the street quickly and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So when you say to me, hey, I don’t think we should be doin’ this. I gotta say, uh- huh. I don’t think we should be doin’ this neither. But we ain’t gonna get a move on in this world layin’ in the sun, lickin’ our ass all day. We men. I mean, you a woman, but we man. (D.Jay leans back, confident} That said... you tell me. What’chu wanna do with your life? Although she is white, NOLA opts to wear long blond mini- braids like most of the black topless dancers at the loca clubs. She is, to her best recollection, 20 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 2.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nola thinks. Struggles. Shrugs. Thinks some more. An idea

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I guess I could...

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Hold up. A car pulls alongside of D.Jay’s Chevy. A beady-eyed, bea Man with pasty white skin examines Nola.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How it go, Cuz? Like what ya see? (He continues to stare) It break down to 20 in the front. 40 in the back. (no answer) Hello? (D.Jay turns to Nola) Hey. Go’on over and explain it to this mother-fucker. Nola steps out of the Chevy wearing yellow hot pants and platform high heels. She marches towards the trick’s car climbs in. D.Jay watches the car drive off as he takes another drag. It’s a slow, hot day in Memphis.

dialogues.speaker: OPENING CREDITS
dialogues.text: curt TO: INT. D.JAY’S CHEVY - DAY D.Jay and Nola are driving downtown in the Chevy. Nola is daydreaming while D.Jay tries to find a good tune on the push button, radio. Nothing sounds good - commercials.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Nothin’ but jive and junk. EXT. ARNEL’S CLUB - DAY D.Jay’s beat-up Chevy rolls on shiny rims as it turns int the parking lot of ARNEL’S CLUB - an urban Juke joint.  Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 3. INT. ARNEL’S CLUB - DAY Nola and D.Jay enter through the front door just as ARNEL tosses a babbiing DRUNK at them.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Goddamn ! Arnel is short and small like a black bulldog, but he’s f of spit for a man in his fifties. He shouts at the drunk.

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: Pull that shit again, nigga, and I'll black boot ya to hell. You heard me! The drunk tries to shout back, but D.Jay grabs him by the hair and tosses his ass out.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Get on, now!

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: Thanks, D. Nola watches with wide eyes as Arnel examines the blood soaked face of the assaulted patron.

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take an angry drunk over a crazy one. Angry drunk, you see somethin’ like this comin’. But them crazies... (puts bar towel on the man’s nose) Just hold that towel on it. We’1l get’cha stitched. {crosses to D.Jay) I think that sun out there is bakin’ peoples brains. D.Jay leans on the bar. Nola climbs onto the stool and sp around like she is a five year old.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: D.Jay, he keep the air on, and all, but it don’t do nothin’ but blow more hot air in my face. So I just stay sticky all day long...

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Just say it’s hot. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 3A.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Always gotta walk around the block with yo trap smackin’ just to get a yes or no. It’s hot. Period. Boom. Arnel hands Nola an orange pop and D.Jay a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 4.

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: Wanna see my kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: I’1l take a peek.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 6 INT. ARNEL’S KITCHEN - LATER - DAY Arnel and D.Jay huddle in the back storage room of the kitchen - Arnel already has his wallet out.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You lookin’ for a half or a full “oO?”

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: Ounce’1l be good. Fourth comin’ up and all. D.Jay reaches into his back pocket and removes an ounce o pot in a clear sandwich bag. ARNEL (CONT’D) Hey. You remember that sticky herb you brung up to my brother’s house for Play- offs?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (holds up the bag) That ain’t this, now. That’s a whole ‘nother zip-lock bag. Fuckin’ prime product you talkin’. I use them “yellow- and-blue-make-green” bags on that shit.

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: How much notice you need?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Little Italian dude from Nawlin’s bring me up an elbow every couple a weeks. What? You need a bag?

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: We got some big company come up in here for the fourth. Thought you may wanna get you some money.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Big company?

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: You remember Skinny? Skinny Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 5.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Shit. I know who Skinny is. We go back in the day. Boy was hustlin’ his underground tapes down at the drive-in out the back of his Cutlass.

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: Not no more, he ain’t. You know that last one he put out went platinum.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (thinks on that) Eh, now Platinum, that’s more special than gold, huh? Arnel shoves the bag into his pocket and then pulls out a modest roll of cash.

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: He big time now... but he still Memphis, you know. He and his brother Tigga hook up with they friends every July. I shut the place down, make it all private for them and they buy up my stock. No shit. They clean me out. D.Jay is suddenly preoccupied. His expression turns serio sullen.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know Skinny. He may not... I mean, you know we went to different schools and all... but... yeah, I know Skinny.

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: You wanna make a dollar, best get up here with that good shit. Those boys ain’t gonna want none a’this dirt weed.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You tryin’ to hurt my feelings?

dialogues.speaker: ARNEL
dialogues.text: Just helpin’ out a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clap of thunder as the bottom falls out of the sky. The KING OF CLUBS sign glows bright red through the rain. Rap pounds the walis from the inside.  Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.Jay enters, holding his over-shirt above his head to st dry. MICKEY is barely audible as he chatters into the micropho from his DJ booth.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: (into the mic) We gotta two for one goin’ on through the next two songs, folks. Any of these lovely ladies will be giving two dances, two dances, fellas, for the price of one. We got Luscious. We got Phoebe. We got Lexus comin’ up on satellite one. (notices D.Jay) ‘Sup, D. Comin’ down, huh? D.Jay nods and crosses to the main stage. Dancers are writhing around the various buckets and pans on the stage collecting rain dripping through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: D. JAY
dialogues.text: (to a dancer) Where Lexus at? The Dancer points. D.Jay turns and finally locates LEXUS. is straddling a trucker in a chair. Her bikini top glows bright orange across her ebony skin, her hair is braided, stretching down her arching back. D.Jay motions her over. Lexus keeps hustling with a smile surreptitiously flipping off D.Jay. He then grabs Lexus b the arm and pulls her off the customer.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: Excuse me! You see me workin’?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Where you at?

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: I ain’t at nothin’. Done three dances all day.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me that. They some homely, ugly-assed, toothless hos in here pullin’ in green and you sayin’... Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 7. 8

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: You think I can come in here, snap my fingers, make these punk asses throw they money at me every night. It just don’t happen some days. Shit, D. I ain’t even gonna make pay out.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: (over the mic) Alright, guys, let’s put your hands together for the lovely Lexus. Lexus starts walking toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: Every bitch in here got some playa, tellin’ ‘em how they can hustle they tricks better than we hustlin’. Bunch’a side-seat drivin’, mother- fuckers. I’11 make my dollar just let me do my thang. Shit, I’m old school!

dialogues.speaker: D. JAY
dialogues.text: It's like I say, you can’t be picky on a Wednesday. You gotta take what they Slangin’. D.Jay waves her off and walks away. Lexus pulls herself u the pole and hangs upsidedown. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversations are loud and full of laughter as D.Jay sells a quarter ounce bag to a dancer in the dressing roo Lexus is getting dressed at a leisurely pace. D.Jay grabs head as she sits to put on her shoes and puts it up to hi stomach.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You hear that? That’s my empty gut sayin’ hurry the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. KING OF CLUBS ~- D.JAY’S CAR - NIGHT 10 Nola awakes from the back seat, sitting up slowly as Lexu and D.Jay hop in the front seat. (CONTTNURD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 8.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: I ain’t doin’ day shift no mo, I don’t care if I gotta get a cab to drop my ass off. I ain’t workin’ with them skank- assed trucker-bait hos no more.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You gonna work day shift if I say. Ain’t no reason...

dialogues.speaker: NOLA LEXUS
dialogues.text: (to D.Jay) (to D.Jay) You said, you was just You know Trudy ain't work runnin’ in. I known y’ali’s day’s no more. It just don’t gonna take your sweet fuckin’ make sense. Tellin’ me she time... I’d a come in. made five hundred dollars... You heard me? Five hundred last night off some guy who makes cotton...

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She ain’t made five hundred dollars. Who? Trudy? Bitch gotta birth mark on her face look like a map a Texas. She trickin’.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: She ain't trickin’.... all she did was dance for him. Suddenly there is a loud pound on the window. Lexus screa D.Jay looks out to see HAROLD - a skinny, pale-skinned, junkie, wearing a few layers of thrift store wind-breaker

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell-fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: (from outside the window) Hey, D.Jay. It’s Harold, man. It’s me. D.Jay jumps out of the car slamming the door behind him. pushes Harold back away from the car.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, man... it’s me... it’s me, D.day... It’s Harold! D.dJAY It’s a damn good thing what I usually got under my belt is under my mother-fuckin’ seat. Sneak up on me like that again, you gonna be grinnin'’ out the back ‘a yo’ head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 9.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Hey, D... um...

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: D.day.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: D.Jday...

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, we ain’t friendly. Call me by my name. D.Jay.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Well, listen, you got some crank, any of that rock shit?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You know I’m strictly gateway. I don’t deal with that.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well... what could I get for this? Harold removes a small electronic KEYBOARD from a sack.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Do I look like a pawn shop?

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Like an ounce? What?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Shit. I wouldn’t give you a toke. Where you get this at?

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: You know... just...

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: If you tell me this belonged to one of yo’ kids I’m just gonna bust.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: No, no... no way, man. I used to play on it. You know, all the time.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: So it work?

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. Like a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 Rev. 6/24/04 {Original White) 10.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (regarding the keyboard) Yeah. I had one of these back in the day. Not as big though.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Bigger is better, D. D.day. D.Jay.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Shut up. (thinks) I’11 give you a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: A quarter? You mean a half... and then some. Pawnshop’1l1 get me more than that.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you give ‘em your thumb print. See how much you get.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: (relents) Okay. D.Jay reaches into his coat pocket and slaps a bag into Harold’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (handing over the keyboard) I don’t think that’s really a fair trade but I... I understand you’ve got to keep an eye on your interests and all.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You pushin’ me. Do you know you pushin’? And Harold is off into the night. D.Jay regards the keybo His fingers touch the keys as a subtle 808 beat pounds in ears: BOOM... BOOM... BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: Hey! Stevie Wonder! {the beat stops) We hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shots. D.Jay’s Chevy rolls through Memphis.  12 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 11. EXT. D.JAY’'S HOUSE - NIGHT il D.day and his girls live in one of many shotgun houses al a crowded street. Kids run past them as they step out of car. D.Jay calls out to an old woman on her porch.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Miss Cole! That runt bitch of yours got in my trash again. I know it won’t your fault but get one yo kids to clean it up.

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: (v.0.) Y’all got tacos?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (v.o.) Naw, we got cheeseburgers.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. D.JAY’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 12 SHUG (short for SUGAR} is a pretty, twenty year old, blac girl who is about four weeks short of giving birth - swol beyond belief for her tiny frame. She is soft spoken, swe Shug bites into a burger as they all watch the TV - a loc rap video program.

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: I called the power comp’ny ‘bout gettin’ an extension on the light bill. They say I gotta come down and stand in line to get an application. (takes a bite) But I can’t be standin’ all day how they do down there. Not if I got Roger with me. You know, D.? You know? A video concludes - another begins. It is a SKINNY BLACK

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (shouting) Oh! There go Skinny! Eh, Lex! LEX!

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: So what do you wanna do, D?

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: h (approaching, pissed) Huh! (CONT TNURD)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 12. 12

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: {pointing to the set} Me and Skinny Black gonna be kickin’ up at Arneli’s on the fourth of July, Baby. Ain’t that some shit?

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: Who? You? The video is standard in aesthetics, gleaming BMWs, booty girls shaking into the lens. Skinny Black is wearing a pristine black and white camouflage suit.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Me and Skinny... do some catch up. You know, he used to live up on Looney and Third. Where they spray down the trolleys at.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to piss myself?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (speaking to Lex as she walks away) Yeah, okay... okay... you tell me. Who is it you know that’s somebody, huh? Who?

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: Nobody in this crib. {speaking in a whiny baby voice) Where’s my baby? Roger?

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: Lex. Don’t. I just got him to sleep. Lexus goes into the back room to retrieve her baby. D.Jay continues to watch the video as Shug complains to the bac his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: D, I know it’s my part in it all to baby- sit while she at work. But she always gotta wake him up just when I get him down. I gotta have some chill time too.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You know, Skinny used to DJ over at Booker T. Just like I did at Westwood. Ain't like he the only nigga spit some flow in this town. I’s doin’ the same thing just at my school. Ask anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 13.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {he has to prove himself) I’m serious. Go ask Carlos up on the corner. He’s in my grade. Ask him.

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: {with a mouth full of burger) Gotta get that extension. 13 INT. D.JAY’S WORK ROOM - NIGHT 13 D.Jay is still holding the small keyboard as he bites int his burger. He opens the door to his private workroom. He turns on a single bulb from above by yanking on a chain. There is a simple scale on the table, a few boxes of sand bags.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (to himself) ++» shit... talk to me about platinum better than gold. In the day, I’s like... triple platinum. Ask anyone... Lexus enters holding her baby boy, ROGER, in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: I gotta shower.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: You gotta watch Rog.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Go give him to Shug.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: She say it’s her chill time.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: {taking the baby) When’s my chill time at? Lexus is gone. D.Jay slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 14 INT. D.JAY’S WORK ROOM ~ LATER - NIGHT 14 D.Jay pushes the POWER BUTTON on the keyboard and then pu the POWER BUTTON on the mini fan on his table. (CONT TNURD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 14.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With Roger tucked under one arm, D.Jay begins pressing th different keys, listening to the various sounds, changing between the different menus. Roger is drooling, mesmerized with sounds just like D.Jay two little boys with a new toy.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: {laughing) Yeah, that buck ain’t it. We CUT IN AND OUT of moments as D.Jay acclimates himself his new keyboard. He takes Roger’s hands and taps them on the keys - each k makes a different beat. They actually manage to peck out Simple beat. D.Jay laughs. The beat is interrupted by Lexus storming into the room wearing a towel around her hips and head.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doin’ wit my son?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Just playin’.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: (pulls Roger away) Give me my baby.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Every time he get settled you gotta come and fuck with him. Gonna give that boy a twitch. The door slams. D.Jay lights a blunt and closes his eyes. The 808 beat can be heard softly - the pounding in his he He opens his eyes and pulls the keyboard closer. Pressing loop button, he matches the keyboard beat to the beat in head. It fits perfectly: Pip. Tack, tack, pip, tack. D.Jay looks on the back of the keyboard. A single headpho jack is on the back. An idea hits as the loop continues. JUMP CUTS as he opens a drawer next to his massive stereo removes a long cable. He pushes it into the inputs behind huge stereo. (CONT TNURD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eee + +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 14A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He picks up the remote. The treble goes to 0. Bass goes t 10. Bass boost activated. The volume diai spins to the loudest possible volume. D.Jay takes the other end of the cable and plugs it into headphone jack on the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The room is vibrating with his beat, as the loop sounds f his towering speakers. D.Jay stands silent, allowing the beats to pound through his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 20 21 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 15-16.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INT. D.JAY’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT 19 Shug awakes on the couch and stares oddly at the door to D.Jay’s work room. The TV distorts with the beat. INT. D.JAY’S WORK ROOM ~- NIGHT 20 D.Jay circles his table, punching at the air with each be The pot scales vibrate. D.Jay bounces his upper body up a down furiously - a man alone with his own invention. He turns off the keyboard with the push of a button. He i panting - suddenly aware of his own heart pounding. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nola snorts up some crank off a small swatch of shiny pap D.Jay and Nola are parked by an old auto shop - hisses an pops sound from inside as D.Jay eyes a car driving up slo

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Go easy, gal. Can’t be no open candy store. We tight this whole week. (D.Jay nudges Nola) Put yo shine on. Here this one come. Nola wipes away sweat as the driver approaches, she attem to put on a sexy scowl for the passing trick.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Cuz. We ain’t gonna bite. The driver tries to get a good look at Nola but then spee past. D.Jay shakes his head in frustration. D.JAY (CONT’D) Goddamn! You go to IHOP to eat pancakes not stare at ‘em. Half the lunch crowd just be window-shoppin’.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: Why can’t we work the motels no more? Least they got air. (CONT TNURD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 17. a1 CONTINUED: 21

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Least they take a cut, is what they do. Thirty dollars a room for one hour on top of what we already chargin’. And that’s what... for a five minute nut. I mean, that just don’t make no sense. That’s money outta my pocket, to keep your country cool.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: All I do is ask about gettin’ cool and you gotta be ugly.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (D.Jay notices the car approaching) Hold up. He comin’ back. You need to put on a show for this trick. Do that thing with your tongue like you do.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: Lex get to work inside all day at the club. I don’t see why I can’t. D.dJAY Cuz we been over this, Nola. Ain’t I told you? You got what they call a bad equilibrium. My uncle Hector had it. You knock into shit. We put you in them heels up on that stage... tricks gonna be screamin’ “timber.” Here he come.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: I’m in heels out here, D! You don’t see me fallin’ down.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Cuz you sittin’, Nola. Ain’t that much of a fall to the floor. Just... look it... let me do the thinkin’ for ya. Ah-ight? Just stick to what you do. And let me do what I do.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: One day you’re gonna have to teil me about that. The trick’s car stops alongside of their car.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: A modest-sized gospel choir takes a deep breath and break into the Spiritual “Keep Your Lamps Trimmed and Burning.” We follow a gray cord from a hanging microphone to a collection of cables. Key is recording the choir from the pews of the church. D.Jay is seated in the center of the church - Nola sits i the back eating an ice cream sandwich. The choir crescendos with chilling intensity. D.Jay is un to move as the song continues. He slowly grips the pew in front of him, his chest rising with deep breaths through flaring nostrils. The music is working on him. The choir concludes abruptly, building into an accented climax. Key holds one hand up in the air, indicating for everyone to remain silent.

dialogues.text: INT. D.JAY’S WORK ROOM - NIGHT 25 D.Jay is smoking a blunt, holding in the smoke and gently blowing it back out. His keyboard holds a steady beat. D.Jay sighs and closes his eyes. Suddenly a wave of fear and paranoia hits. Something or someone just charged at him. He scrambles to his feet, looking around the room. What was that? He holds his chest and tries to control his rapid panting He is alone in the room. He looks at the blunt and then guickly taps it out into the bowl. He turns the keyboard OFF. cur TO: INT. D.JAY’S LIVINGROOM - LATER - NIGHT 26 It is unusually quiet in the room. Nola sleeps on one cou as Shug sleeps on the adjacent one. D.Jay is gently shaking Shug awake.

I mean... I mean he’s my age. (thinks on that) That’s been fuckin’ with my head. Like this is it for me. It’s fuckin’ with my Mode on the track, can’t concentrate, can’t smoke weed without feelin’ like I’m gettin’ a heart attack and... and 1 don’t know what I’m supposed to do.

dialogues.text: So, Beth Ann tells me the reason I didn’t get moved up into Sales Supervisor is because I have issues enforcing company policy with my co-workers. Who she referred to as my friends, not co-workers but friends. I said, just because I am pleasant and supportive does not mean I cannot... (a new mouthful) Crack a whip. Cuz I can crack a whip. I mean, you’ve seen me crack a whip.

dialogues.text: (chewing his meatloaf) Mm-hm.

I know everything that everybody is doing wrong. Beth Ann take way too long on her lunch break. Allen, that little shit back in receiving came to work high. Not to mention yesterday Sally was wearing a skirt from our discontinued line. And I know she didn’t pay for it. Now, do you think I’m gonna turn a blind eye to these violations if I was Sales Supervisor, just cuz I’m nice? Key isn’t aware that Yevette is waiting for an answer. Sh holds out two wrinkled 20's, but D.Jay is too busy writin flow in his note pad to notice. Defeated and ignored, Nola places the two 20’s on the sea In silence, she carefully peeks over at his notes. D.Jay takes notice.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: I’m tellin’ you... this is hard work. To take what’s in your mind... and put it into words that fit together like a puzzle... D.Jay returns to writing. Nola curiously watches.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: I wish there was somethin’. You know, somethin’ I could...

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Shit, baby, you’re my operation. You what they call my primary investor. Making all this shit happen one trick at a time. Nola looks out the window, discouraged. D.Jay notices. He turns her face toward him. He gently touches her face. D.JAY (CONT’D) Think about how I found you at the truck stop. You the smallest lot lizard I ever seen, trickin’ them truckers for change. {serious) I love you, Nola. Not like a man loves a woman. But like a brother. Like you my own blood. Cuz I know, girl. I know what it is to be lost. Wantin’ to be a part of somethin’. And I’m tellin’ you. You a part of this. D.Jay takes her tiny hands and places them on the steerin wheel. He wraps his hands around hers.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: You know what this means? {she shakes her head) Means we got our hands on the wheel. We in charge, you and me. None of these tricks out here. We in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 48 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: D.JAY (CONT’D) I wanna hear you say it, so I can believe in you like you do me. Go’on. Nola feels D.Jay’s warmth spread through her chest. His w are working on her.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: We’re in charge.

It bleeds in with the background. My head looks like it’s floating in a tub of milk. (shows D.Jay his license) See?

dialogues.text: You know... I may pimp. I may hustle, I may got to roll in circles that folks might find... you know, objectionable. But let me tell you... I roll with God.

dialogues.text: Cuz for me... God is peace of mind. (Key hums his approval) God is a standard that man should set for his’seif. God... to me... is like... a distribution deal. Another set of tokes. Jumping to later.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: With a whole album, ten or twelve is okay. But you make a demo that just gives a little bit of a taste, like what kind’a style we got. What makes us... us.

dialogues.text: This is the South Memphis scene. Blacks, Mexicans and bol white rednecks roam the parkinglot in packs, scanning the fresh parade of young ladies. Music, fights, flirting. D.Jay and Key sit in the front seat of the parked car. Sh and Nola are outside, leaning against the back of the Che D.dJay has two Styrofoam cups. He produces a bottle of Cr Royal and begins making their @rinks. D.dAY Way you been takin’ care of me and mine... you get as fucked up as you want. I got your back tonight.

dialogues.text: Ain’t been lit like this in long time... I don’t know if I should be... is that Crown? Oooo. Breakin’ out the good shit. Pass that on over. Outside, Nola and Shelby watch the cars roll by slowly - nightly mating ritual.

dialogues.text: I restock vending machines. You know, soda. Candy. Microwave popcorn. All that shit. I gotta get up at the crack and hit all these truck stops off the interstate before I head over to the high schools. I’m alone all day and I smell like Skittles and sticky buns.

dialogues.text: I thought my job sucked.

dialogues.speaker: SHELBY
dialogues.text: Well, what I lack in benefits... I make up for in Moon Pies. Inside the car, Key kills the last of his drink. D.Jay gi him another refill.

dialogues.text: So this shit about Skinny... That’s real? Cuz even if he listens to what we got, we don’t know what he’s gonna do with it. It’s a one in million shot, D. One ina million...

dialogues.text: If I can pimp 20 dollar tricks out the back of a Chevy... I can pimp Skinny.

Head to toe. I ain’t no front-faggot-bitch! You hear me? D.Jay is caught in her tirade. He can’t even look away.

dialogues.speaker: LEXUS
dialogues.text: I'll be right here. On my stage. Doin’ my thing. Now who the fuck is you? Huh? I wanna hear ya, baby. Come on! Who the fuck is you? EXT. KING OF CLUBS -— NIGHT 100 D.Jay throws the door to the club open gripping the side the building to steady himself. He takes deep breaths to stave off nausea. Reaching under leather coat, D.Jay retrieves Skinny’s gun. With his free hand, he grips the silver watch on his oppo wrist - the hand holding the gun. A decision has been made.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. D.JAY’S CHEVY - NIGHT 100A As D.Jay drives up his street, his view through the windshield glows with blue and red pulsating lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 106.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The police are there in full force. Arnel is with them, reluctantly, along with the remaining Skinny Black crew, including Tigga. D.Jay pulls to the side of the road and hops out.

dialogues.speaker: TIGGA
dialogues.text: There he is! There that mutha~fucka go, * right there! Shoot his ass! * D.Jay immediately raises his hands into the air. The poli spin around and pull their side arms into position.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: Put down your weapon and step away from the car.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (stepping away form the car) I ain’t got nothin’ on me, it’s in the glove.

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: (running toward D.Jay) D.Jay! D.Jay! Nola runs after her trying to stop her. Three police offi hold her back. Key and Shelby rush to the end of the stre

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Ease up, Shug, it’s ah-ight.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: (screaming at the police) Get off her! Get off her!

dialogues.speaker: TIGGA
dialogues.text: Hey! Shoot him! Shoot the motherfucker! The police wrestle Shug to the ground as she screams. BOOM! A firework sounds above.

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: (crying) I just wanna go with him! I wanna go!

dialogues.speaker: D. JAY
dialogues.text: (yelling at the cops) Goddammit, get off her! She’s pregnant! * Get off! Key get them niggaz off my girl! (CONT TNURFD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 107.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Key looks shell shocked. Shelby rushes to help Nola with Shug.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: (calling out to D.Jay) Put your hands on the hood of your car!

dialogues.speaker: D. JAY
dialogues.text: Get ‘em off her!

dialogues.speaker: SHUG
dialogues.text: D.Jay... D.Jday, please...! The police help Shug up to her feet. Nola and Shelby come her side and helps her stand.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: Come to the front of the car! Do it! Now! D.Jgay slowly moves to the front of the car, hands raised Shug is on her knees, sobbing into Nola’s stomach. D.Jay turns to the front of the car slowly putting his pa down on the hood of his own Chevy. He is slammed from behind by three officers. Shug screams out. Nola has tears running down her face as she holds tightly onto Shug, quivering in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: (yelling at the officers) He turned himself in! He turned himself in! Don’t dog pile him like that! Nola can see D.Jay with his face on the hood of the Chevy he is grunting in pain and humiliation. Tigga has made it closer to D.Jay. He taunts him.

dialogues.speaker: TIGGA
dialogues.text: That’s my brother you fuckin’ with! That’s my brother! I’m gonna get you stuck! In the joint, Bitch! The police empty his pockets. Three demo tapes are sprawl out on the hood of the car followed by his notepad. A sudden panic comes over Nola. She rushes past the polic the side of the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: D.day? D.Jay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 191 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 108.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: D.Jay opens his eyes as another officer tries to move Nol back. She resists. NOLA (CONT’D) (pleading) Tell me what to do. Please tell me what to do. Her plea is exactly what D.Jay needs to hear - his confid restored.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Pick up my pad. (Nola picks up the pad) Disc Jockeys, baby. Get ya ass off the track and get our shit some play. Put it in their hands, baby. Make ’em play it! The cops Lift D.Jay up and puli him away. D.JAY (CONT’D) POLICE I got a stack of demos in the You have the right to remai car. Tell Key and Shelby to silent, anything you say can get that shit on disc. In two and will be held against yo weeks I wanna hear my music in a court of law... in the yard at 201. You in charge Nola. Say it.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Say it, Nola! Nola follows him as they pull him away. Tigga brakes free punches D.Jay to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SHELBY KEY
dialogues.text: HEY! Get the FUCK OFF HIM! Nola covers her mouth as police push Tigga back. A fight now erupted between the members of Skinny’s crew and D.Ja neighbor, R.L.. Shelby and Key are filled with rage, they race at Tigga. Shelby is the first to clock him as the two join the figh D.Jday is lifted to his feet again, blood leaking from hi nose. He is smiling - alive with confidence for Nola’s benefit. (CONTTNUFD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 32 103 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 109.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, baby! Who’s in charge?

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: {sobbing) I’m in charge.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: There you go. Say it again, partner.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: I’M IN CHARGE! D.Jay is shoved in the back seat of a squad car. It has n turned to mayhem: photographers, neighborhood thugs pound the car. The squad car disappears around the corner, leaving Shug weeping and Nola standing alone in the street, quivering the pulsating lights. Fireworks crackle in the night sky. FADE TO BLACK. INT. D.JAY’S JAIL CELL - DAY 102 The cell door opens. With a grinding rhythm the bars move past D.Jay’s unmoving eyes. D.Jay walks through the corridor, his head lowered, his h in his pockets. A Prison Guard walks behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.Jay enters the room divided by protective glass ~ priso on one side, visitors on the other. Sitting with his arms crossed, looking appropriately pens is Key. D.Jay picks up the phone. Key waits a moment before picki up his side, choosing to stare at D.Jay instead.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: I tried callin’ the house but... the phones...

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. They got turned off. But it’s okay. Me and Yevette, we pitching in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 109A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Key removes a picture of a baby girl and places it up aga the plexi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White} 110.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KEY (CONT’D} Baby girl, in case you was wonderin’.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (sadness and joy) Awe... she’s precious. Look at that. What she callin’ it?

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: Named her Kiesha.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Kiesha? No shit. That’s a good handle. I like that. Kiesha. D.Jay suddenly tears up. It surprise him, embarrasses him Key puts the picture away abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With what I got to do... with the people I got in my life... it feels like an eternity in here. I can’t get my Mode back. I don’t hear a thing.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: Whenever you say somethin’ serious to me, you always say, “look me in the eye.” You know? (D.Jay nods) Now I want you to look me in the eye. (leans in) Did you know Skinny Black... before that night? D.Jay sits in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: D. JAY
dialogues.text: This little girl, Keisha... she gonna dream large like kids do, you know. One day she gonna ask me if she can grow up and be President. (silence) Now I know this girl got a ho for a momma and some trick for a daddy, ain’t nobody know where he at. But I tell you, Key, I’m gonna look that girl right in the eyes... and I’m gonna lie. Cuz sometimes you got to. Key understands. He takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: So what’ chu been doin’? (CONT TNURD)

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: Back to a whole lot more of the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Key is sweating as he loads his gear into the back of his van.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: (v.o.} I’m back to recording depositions and school recitals. We CUT AHEAD to him waiting at a stop light. Next to him, car load of young men roll up in a convertible blaring ra music.. Key looks sad and defeated.

dialogues.speaker: KEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (v.o.} You talk about eternity. Yeah, that’s been on my mind, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby is pushing a crate of soda cans through the front of a truck stop. He waves to the woman behind the counter

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: (v.o.) It’s been on all our minds. Shelby begins stocking the machine with product. INT. D,JAY’S HOUSE - DAY 106 Shug holds her baby in her arms and looks out the window if she is waiting for D.Jay to come home.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: (v.o0.) We was just dead. Locked up just like you. But ain’t no sorrow gonna take away Shug’s song, let me tell you. She got love for you, D. When you talk on eternity. You think about your woman. She softly hums a song.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 7 108 09 110 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.Jay nods. He ponders Shug’s sadness and takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: What about Nola?

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: Nola. Weil... let me say this. That girl got a Mode of her own. Cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High hat beats as we see D.Jay’s Chevy roll up and stop. Nola steps out dressed in a tight, mini-skirt suit. In he ear is a mobile phone headset. The cord dangles free beca there is no phone. She tucks the slack in her small purse

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: {v.o.) That girl hit the bricks runnin’. Somehow she got it in her head that she was in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan across the mix board.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: (v.0.) She hit every shake joint and station Memphis got and then some. Now I don’t know how she did it... but let me say that girl got some skills. We see Nola suggestively sitting on a DJ’s lap. She passe him a joint and puts on the charm.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: We can’t lay around lickin’ our ass all day like a dog. I mean, we man. I know I’m a girl and all but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nola hops in the Chevy and cranks the engine. She starts pushing the buttons on the old radio. (CONT TNUFD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White} 113.

dialogues.speaker: NOLA
dialogues.text: (v.o.) We mankind. The dial hops to different sides and stops on a familiar beat. It is the Whoop That Trick song. The camera spins and stops on our crew hearing the track the first time.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Whoop that trick... get ‘em Whoop that trick... get ‘em Whoop that trick... get ‘em Whoop that trick... get ‘em

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby drops a case of sodas as he runs over to the front counter. He reaches past the woman and grabs her radio. H cranks up the volume and grins wildly.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Whoop that trick... get ‘em. Whoop that trick... get ‘em. Whoop that trick... get ‘em. Whoop that trick... get ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys in the convertible are bouncing to the track. Th flinch as Key starts screaming out his van window.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: That's D.Jay... That's D.Jay! THAT’S MY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey bobs his head to the track in the booth. We SPIN T the stage and see Lexus look over her shoulder with a gla

dialogues.speaker: SPIN TO
dialogues.text: +e Fe OF Oe OE OF  14 115 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 113A. INT. D.JAY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN — DAY 114 Shug is crying with joy. Her tiny baby is on her lap. She rapping along with D.Jay bouncing her baby.

dialogues.speaker: SPIN TO
dialogues.text: EXT. RADIO STATION - D.JAY’S CHEVY - DAY 115 Nola is on top of the world. Sitting in the driver's seat she pops a cigarette in her mouth. She pushes in on the cigarette lighter. (CONT TNUFD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 116 17 Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 114.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It pops out. The music stops as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.Jay can’t hide his awe. Key reaches into his pocket and pulls out D.Jay’s notepad and flips through the pages.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: So, if you don’t mind... Nola and I got a few points we would like to go over in regards to your agenda. {a big smile from D.Jay) If you got a minute to spare.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: (returning the grin) I got more than a minute. I got eleven months.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. D.JAY’S JAIL CELL - DAY 117 The Prison Guard escorts D.Jay back to his cell. The Pris Block Manager rushes up and stops them.

dialogues.speaker: BLOCK MANAGER
dialogues.text: Albert, hold up. The Prison Guard stops D.day. BLOCK MANAGER (CONT*’ D) (addressing D.Jay) You the man on the radio. That Whoop that trick song.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD
dialogues.text: What’chu talkin’ about?

dialogues.speaker: BLOCK MANAGER
dialogues.text: This that guy who stomped on Skinny. You know that song, Whoop that trick... get ‘em...

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD
dialogues.text: (singing) Whoop that trick.... Get ‘em. Whoop that trick... Get’em,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 {Original White) 114A.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD
dialogues.text: (to D.Jay) Oh yeah. Shit. That’s you? (CONT TNURD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. 6/24/04 (Original White) 115.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: D.Jay grins and shrugs. His confidence returning.

dialogues.speaker: BLOCK MANAGER
dialogues.text: (looks over his shoulder) You know... we in the rap game, too. D.Jay turns to the Block Manager who grins proudly.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Naw shit?

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD
dialogues.text: See, we got it goin’ on both sides, being from the streets and now, you know, being officers of the law. Gonna be my tag. Goin’ as 5-0. You know, like my stage name. Big 5-0. D.Jay can not believe what he is hearing. The Block Manag secretly hands him a demo tape: BIG 5-0 and BLOCK C.

dialogues.speaker: BLOCK MANAGER
dialogues.text: When you get a chance, in the rec room. Let us know what you think. D.Jay takes the tape and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Well... you know what they say.

dialogues.speaker: BLOCK MANAGER
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: D.JAY
dialogues.text: Everybody gotta have a dream, D.Jay turns away and walks back to his cell with the guar keeping a respectful distance. The 808 pounding returns to his ears and swagger: BOOM... BOOM... BOOM... BOOM. D.Jay’s smile fades as his Mode returns. He looks right a - hungry, determined. The 808 can’t get any louder.
